forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 58. West southwest wind 7 to 10 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Drizzle then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 66 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 6 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As the night deepens over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries with it a whisper of the Pacific, promising the possibility of a light drizzle later, yet nothing substantial drapes the city in dampness. The cloud cover blankets the skyline, rendering a muted, gray canvas where the iconic outlines of landmarks like the Golden Gate Bridge blend into the softness of the evening. The wind, gentle yet persistent from the west, stirs occasionally, refreshing rather than chilling the air. With temperatures settling around a comfortable 58 degrees, it is a night that invites light layers—think of a soft sweatshirt or a light jacket to wrap yourself in against the coolness.

Looking towards Saturday, the promise of a slightly brighter day looms. Drizzle may greet the early hours, giving way to the sun's earnest attempt to break free from its marine cloak. By afternoon, the temperature will flirt with 68 degrees, a refreshing respite, though it may dip back to a cooler 66 shortly thereafter. One can expect a gentle breeze to accompany the sunshine, encouraging leisurely strolls along the waterfront. Those planning their day should opt for comfortable attire—perhaps light pants and a breathable top accompanied by a light cardigan for moments when the breeze picks up. It’s the kind of day where one might enjoy a casual coffee at an outdoor café, or wander through the vibrant streets of the Mission, taking in the vibrant culture painted on the walls and the chatter of locals. Recognize that while fog may linger in the edges of your view, it adds a touch of charm, reminding us that every layer of cloud, or hint of sun, is part of the character of this endlessly enchanting city.
